main_definition: Eleven is a numerical value representing the quantity or position in a sequence, as well as an idiomatic expression referring to a group of people who are not very close friends.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A number that comes after ten and before twelve. It is represented numerically by 11.
meanings_and_examples.example: There were eleven players on the soccer team.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic expression used to describe a group of people who are not very close friends or acquaintances. This phrase originates from poker, where if there are eleven players at a table, they would typically share no cards and each player would have only one opponent.
meanings_and_examples.example: In their small town, the local book club meets up every week to discuss books, but despite meeting regularly, they're just 'eleven', not close friends.
